snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey’s announcement of an unusual special election was immediately criticized for costing the state $24 million and for setting up a schedule that was likely to confuse the voting public.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's announcement of highly unusual special Senate election to fill the seat of the late Sen Frank R Lautenberg is immediately criticized for costing state $24 million and potentially confusing the voting public; Democrats accuse Christie of squandering taxpayer money to protect his own political ambitions, and Republicans say he has betrayed their interests.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and DAVID M. HALBFINGER
byline.contributor: Kate Zernike reported from Trenton, and David M. Halbfinger from New York. Raymond Hernandez and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey’s announcement of an unusual special election was immediately criticized for costing the state $24 million and for setting up a schedule that was likely to confuse the voting public.

headline.seo: Christie Criticized for Cost and Timing of Senate Election
headline.main: Christie Decides on October Vote for New Senator
headline.print_headline: Christie Decides On October Vote For New Senator
